com.ndi

Class EnumFormatValidator.Builder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.ndi.EnumFormatValidator.Builder
  • Enclosing class:
    EnumFormatValidator

    public static class EnumFormatValidator.Builder
extends java.lang.Object
    This is a static inner class that can used to construct an instance of EnumFormatValidator.

    • Method Detail

      • setFormatTag

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder setFormatTag(java.lang.String formatName)
        Parameters:
        formatName - The name of our customized format tag
        Returns:
        an instance of FormatValidatorBuilder with the field formatName being initialized

      • setRules

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder setRules(Rules rules)
        Parameters:
        rules - The validation rules: it should be an instance of HashMap. It should contains at least one of the two keys: 1) "correct", 2) suggestions (which is optional), whose values need to be an instance of java.util.List. The value of the key "correct" consists of a list of accepted columns (that is if the user enters an entry that belongs to an entry in one of the columns, we accept the user's entry), otherwise if the user has entered an entry in the list of "suggestions" value's column, then the error message will provide hints that allows the user to enter the value in the corrected column
        Returns:
        return an instance of FormatValidatorBuilder with rules being initialized
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the input is null or the Rules object does not contain at least one 'correct' column, which the Validator will accept if the entry comes from that column

      • setFilePath

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder setFilePath(java.lang.String filePath)
        set the file path of the gzip/txt file
        Parameters:
        filePath: - the given filepath
        Returns:
        an instance of FormatValidatorBuilder with filePath initialized
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the file path is null or the file it links to does not exist

      • setTableFormat

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder setTableFormat(TableFormat tableFormat)
        set the table format of the builder object
        Parameters:
        tableFormat - an instance of the tableFormat object specifying how each column is split and how each entry in each column is separated
        Returns:
        a new instance of Builder object with a valid tableFormat field initialized
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the input (tableFormat) is null

      • loadDataGzip

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder loadDataGzip()
        Read the gzip file from the given file path, then convert it into an instance of Table object. This methods assumes that the row of the columns are split by a new line, and the first row should specify the column names. Also make sure that each entry does not contain any character that you use to split each entry in the row, or else the behavior may be undefined
        Returns:
        the FormatValidatorBuilder with the table initialized
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when any error occurs while reading the text file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when filePath, rules, tableFormat have not been initialized or the the Rules object does not contain any 'correct' field, which are used to indicate the column whose entries will be accepted by the Format Validator

      • loadData

        public EnumFormatValidator.Builder loadData()
        Does everything that the loadDataGzip does, except it works for text file instead.
        Returns:
        the FormatValidatorBuilder with the table object field being initialized
        Throws:
        java.lang.RuntimeException - when any error occurs while reading the text file
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when filePath, rules, tableFormat has not been initialized, or when the file ends with .gz extension, or the the Rules object does not contain any 'correct columns', which are used to indicate the column whose entries will be accepted by the Format Validator

      • build

        public EnumFormatValidator build()
        Build an instance of AdvancedEnumFormatValidator based on the field set in the FormatValidatorBuilder object.
        Returns:
        an instance of AdvancedEnumFormatValidator
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either formatName, rules, filePath, tableFormat has not been initialized or the size of the rules object does not specify a column that the Validator should accept
